required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Intermittent Theta Burst Stimulation on Motor Learning in Healthy Adults
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Intermittent Theta Burst Stimulation on Motor Learning in Healthy Adults

brief_summary.textblock: This study investigates the effect of different application frequencies of intermittent theta burst stimulation on motor learning in healthy adults.

primary_outcome.description: The total right answers and the mean response time in the finger taping task will be recorded

arm_group.arm_group_label: Finger Taping Task + iTBS Daily group
arm_group.description: Finger Taping Task + iTBS Daily application group: the group receives these applications every consecutive day for 5 days.
Finger Taping Task Daily application Group: the group receives the training every consecutive day for 5 days.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Finger Taping Task + iTBS intermittent group
arm_group.description: Finger Taping Task + iTBS Daily application group: the group receives these applications every other day for 5 sessions.
Finger Taping Task intermittent application group: the group receives the application every other day for 5 sessions.

intervention.description: neuromodulation: Neuromodulation is technology that acts directly upon nerves. It is the alteration-or modulation-of nerve activity by delivering electrical or magnetic stimulus/current.
intervention.arm_group_label: Finger Taping Task + iTBS Daily group
Finger Taping Task + iTBS intermittent group

intervention.description: motor learning training requires performing a sequential training called finger taping task
intervention.arm_group_label: Finger Taping Task + iTBS Daily group

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- being at the age of 40-75 years
Exclusion Criteria:
- visual disability
- cognitive or psychiatric problems such as dementia, depression, etc.
